title: I'm going to ruin your favorite champion for you.
body:

{{champion:75}} **END-GAME FANTASIES ARE OVERRATED:** _Nasus Q stacks cap at 2000. An arbitrary number no one will reach, but you will now have to play forever knowing you can never one shot dragons or turrets._

Size doesn't actually slow you down, it just slows down the animation. Because he's taking bigger steps, he has to take fewer of them to go the same speed.

Theoretically you're right. But good luck not getting minion blocked with a big ass model.

> Sona's abilities no longer affect players with their in game audio muted.

You're too late, patch 4.13 already did this regardless of whether audio is muted or not.
That didn't ruin {{champion:154}}  for me. You can do better.
{{champion:154}} **HUE**: Is no longer a wabbly green blob, but rather a small fluffy yordle in a rabbit costume.

Zac no longer gains increased distance on his e when leveled up.
Zac's passive now heals 4% of his missing health
Zac's abilities all cost 4% of his maximum health
Zac's blobs will now spawn farther from zac
Zac's Revive has his blobs spawn closer, but the time it takes to reform is the same.
Zac's jump no longer has cc attached.
Zac's w no longer has reduced cooldown for blobs picked up.
Zac's q has a smaller missile width and no longer has a slow.
Zac's Ult has a longer cd and a 40% slow on bounce instead of a knockup.
Zac can no longer use w while ulting.

I'm using the rito philosophy, if a small thing doesn't ruin a champion, gut them into oblivion.
